cab.content: s;ThisJDoounwnt^is^ the Property of His Britannic Majesty1s ' Government) .1,202 STOA B I H E T.Copy No. ^^/jlSSS. 0-f Ji1G ^evam Estuary as ja Source^of^Hydro graphic Invo s t investigation t i on Jb^ the mAdmirti3.ty^Memorandum hy the First Lord of the Admiralty,With reference to the request contained in Cabinet 44(25) Conclusion 4(a), and to paragraph 3 on page 2 of C .P .382( 25) , I am now in a position to s;fcate that the Admiralty can arrange for the next stage of the investigation into the Severn Barrage Scheme to be carried out by the Admiralty Hydrographic Service on the basis suggested by the Cabinet, ivas by postponing other Survey work so that, although the Admiralty would be recouped for their expenditure from the funds allotted to the Severn Barrage Enquiry no additional State expenditure would be involved.(INITD) vV.G .B.Admi ra Ity S .W * 1.11th August, 1925.
